data.statement: What is the SI unit of magnetic flux?
Which law states that the magnetic intensity at any point due to a magnetic pole is directly proportional to the pole strength and inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the pole?
What is the phenomenon where a material becomes magnetized in the direction of an external magnetic field and retains its magnetization after the field is removed?
In a magnetic field, the force experienced by a current-carrying conductor is described by which law?
Which type of magnetism occurs when a material is weakly attracted to a magnetic field, and the magnetic dipoles align parallel to the field?
What is the unit of magnetic susceptibility?
In a magnetic material, the region where all the magnetic dipoles are aligned in the same direction is called what?
What is the principle behind a magnetic coil or solenoid producing a magnetic field when current flows through it?
Which material is characterized by having zero magnetic permeability and is repelled by a magnetic field?
What is the term for the magnetic field strength inside a magnetized material?
